item.title: Lisa add a quote by A.M. Homes
item.description: "I think you can write about what you know for about an hour and a half. Then you have to start bullshitting. So I say, lie to me and lie to me well. The only way to write well is to write accurately. Accuracy is not about the reader, it’s about the subject and the character." -- A.M. Homes

item.title: Lisa add a quote by Miranda July
item.description: "What a terrible mistake to let go of something wonderful for something real." -- Miranda July

item.title: Lisa add a quote by Amy Gerstler
item.description: "The throat is a road." -- Amy Gerstler

item.title: Lisa add a quote by Jenny Saville
item.description: "If there's a narrative, I want it in the flesh." -- Jenny Saville

item.title: Lisa add a quote by Diane Arbus
item.description: "A picture is a secret about a secret, the more it tells you the less you know." -- Diane Arbus

item.title: Lisa add a quote by Joan Didion
item.description: "I write entirely to find out what I'm thinking, what I'm looking at, what I see and what it means. What I want and what I fear." -- Joan Didion

item.title: Lisa add a quote by Joan Didion
item.description: "We tell ourselves stories in order to live...We look for the sermon in the suicide, for the social or moral lesson in the murder of five. We interpret what we see, select the most workable of the multiple choices. We live entirely, especially if we are writers, by the imposition of a narrative line upon disparate images, by the "ideas" with which we have learned to freeze the shifting phantasmagoria which is our actual experience." -- Joan Didion

item.title: Lisa add a quote by Audrey Niffenger
item.description: "I don't know about you, but I'm kind of fed up with realism. After all, there's enough reality already; why make more of it? Why not leave realism for the memoirs of drug addicts, the histories of salt, the biographies of porn stars? Why must we continue to read about the travails of divorced people or mildly depressed Canadians when we could be contemplating the shopping habits of zombies, or the difficulties that ensue when living and dead people marry each other? We should be demanding more stories about faery handbags and pyjamas inscribed with the diaries of strange women. We should not rest until someone writes about a television show that features the Free People's World-Tree Library, with its elaborate waterfalls and Forbidden Books and Pirate-Magicians. We should be pining for a house haunted by rabbits." -- Audrey Niffenger

item.title: Lisa add a quote by Margaret Cho
item.description: "I want Jesus to come back and say 'THATS NOT WHAT I MEANT'" -" -- Margaret Cho

item.title: Lisa add a quote by Ernest Hemingway
item.description: "Isn't it pretty to think so." -- Ernest Hemingway

item.title: Lisa add a quote by Paul Celan
Lisa add a quote by Joan Didion
item.description: "You have to pick the places you don't walk away from." -- Joan Didion

item.title: Lisa add a quote by Tennessee Williams
item.description: "Why did I write? Because I found life unsatisfactory." -- Tennessee Williams

item.title: Lisa add a quote by Tennessee Williams
item.description: "A prayer for the wild at heart kept in cages." -- Tennessee Williams

item.title: Lisa add a quote by Rob Lowe
item.description: "I’ve said before that the common perception that all good actors should be good liars is exactly the opposite; only bad actors lie when they act." -- Rob Lowe
